item.title: Death Stranding 2: Order 10 Walkthrough
item.description:
After making your way to Australia in Death Stranding 2 , Sam will now have to connect all the Safehouses and Distribution Centres in the country to the Chiral Network with the help of Drawbridge . One of the early orders in Australia has you liberating the Western Environmental Observatory from the Brigands.

By the time players acquire this mission, they will possess a strong arsenal to use against the Bandits. However, as there are around eight Bandits in the Observatory, it is best to strategize beforehand and decide how to clear out the enemy camp in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach .

Order 10 Walkthrough in Death Stranding 2

To start Order 10, you must make your way to the Government's Base and connect it using the Q-Pid. Head to the location, but stay around 200m away so you can scout and check everything, including the enemies' locations and patrol patterns. You can either build a Watchtower , which allows you to mark everything and makes the encounter much easier, or, if you don't have a PCC, simply open the Weapons/Tools wheel and select the Dollman Cam, which allows Sam to throw the Doll up for reconnaissance .

Once scouting is done, you can either go for the stealth approach or go all-out with guns. If you're going stealth, it's best to deal with the enemy on top of the Watchtower first . If you're doing the Order at night, you can easily climb the ladder and perform a Stealth Knockdown on the enemy above to prevent him from revealing your position with the spotlight. Once he's dealt with, you can take out the remaining enemies using a Strand in a similar manner.

Use the Odradek arm to scan the area multiple times as you clear out the enemies.

If you don't prefer stealth, then use the Tranq Sniper Rifle, which you get after completing two Sub-Orders for the Lone Commander. The Bola Gun is also a great choice, as you can shoot the strands from a medium distance and go in for a punch if they resist.

Order 10 Rewards in Death Stranding 2

Once this is done, you can complete the mission, which will give you the following rewards:

  • Battle Skeleton Lv1
  • Battle Skeleton: Silver Lv1
  • Battle Skeleton: Gold Lv1
  • Grenade Pistol [MP]
  • MP Grenades
  • Aim Assistance (APAS Enhancement)
  • Faster Scanner Recharging (APAS Enhancement)
  • Swift MULE Postbox Hacking (APAS Enhancement)

There are quite a few resources, as well as MULE Postboxes , that you can hack for more materials and items.

item.title: Animal Crossing: The Best Possible Reveal Date for a New Switch 2 Game is Quickly Approaching
item.description:
With the Nintendo Switch 2 now out in the world, many are wondering what exclusive titles may be on the horizon. The Switch 2’s current lineup is looking a little slim despite the console being a major financial success. Many eyes are no doubt on what upcoming announcements Nintendo has under its sleeve. One of the biggest possible announcements is a successor to Animal Crossing: New Horizons . With Animal Crossing: New Horizons taking the world by storm at launch, a sequel seems like a guarantee.

The ball is in Nintendo’s court to mitigate potential critiques surrounding the Switch 2 with media-consuming announcements, and an easy way to resolve that is by looking at the calendar. The best possible reveal date for the next Animal Crossing game is quickly approaching, and Nintendo has the unique opportunity to have some fun with it.

K.K. Slider’s Birthday is Coming Up

Every Animal Crossing villager has a birthday, something fans have historically loved to celebrate in-game and outside it, especially with their birthday twins. Some birthdays may be more notable than others, especially if they belong to a notable NPC like Isabelle or Blathers.

K.K. Slider’s birthday is August 23. With that being less than a month away, celebrating it seems a given, but celebrating it with the announcement of a new Animal Crossing game would be the best possible gift for the would-be mascot and his fans. Timing is always important, and with the ever-rising popularity of cozy games, there really hasn't been a better time to announce a new AC title than right now.

The Case for K.K. Slider To Be The Mascot

While many look toward Tom Nook or Isabelle as Animal Crossing ’s official mascot, fans should not overlook K.K. Slider as an official titleholder for the position. Unlike Isabelle, K.K. has been serenading players since the very first Animal Crossing title launched in 2001. An announcement on August 23 would be a love letter to all the Animal Crossing players who have been here for the journey for as long as they’ve been gaming, embracing a foundational character to propel the franchise forward.

Other Animal Crossing NPC Birthdays Are Far From Ideal For An Announcement

If Nintendo were to wait for another Animal Crossing NPC’s birthday to announce the next game, it may run into trouble capturing public attention alongside other challenges. Each NPC's birthday falls on specific dates throughout the year. If those NPCs are mascot-esque figures, however, the seasons and dates for those aren’t favorable for an announcement at all.

Tom Nook’s Birthday: A Missed Opportunity

Nintendo's window to utilize Tom Nook’s birthday has passed, as it was on May 30. Given that the Nintendo Switch 2 was launched on June 5, a May 30 announcement could have distracted from the upcoming launch of the system. As such, it made sense not to do it then, but May 30 next year would also miss out on the momentum of the Switch 2.

Isabelle’s Birthday: Too Busy a Season

Nintendo’s other opportunity would naturally be Isabelle’s and Digby’s on December 20, but the holiday season is better for releasing games, not announcing them. Combine this with the proximity to Christmas and The Game Awards that take place a few days later, Isabelle's birthday would be too busy for Animal Crossing fans.

Overall, the best time seems to be now. KK Slider's birthday hits all the marks that Tom Nook and Isabelle's don't, while also capitalizing on the current momentum of the Switch 2. It all remains to be seen, of course, but fans shouldn't be surprised if it happens. Instead, they should wish KK Slider a happy birthday and keep an eye out for even more news as it develops throughout the year.

10 Images
10 Images

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Escape to a deserted island and create your own paradise as you explore, create, and customize in the Animal Crossing: New Horizons game. Your island getaway has a wealth of natural resources that can be used to craft everything from tools to creature comforts. You can hunt down insects at the crack of dawn, decorate your paradise throughout the day, or enjoy sunset on the beach while fishing in the ocean. The time of day and season match real life, so each day on your island is a chance to check in and find new surprises all year round.

Show off your island utopia to family and friends—or pack your bags and visit theirs. Whether playing online** or with others beside you***, island living is even better when you can share it. Even without hopping on a flight, you’ll meet a cast of charming animal residents bursting with personality. Friendly faces like Tom Nook and Isabelle will lend their services and happily help you grow your budding community. Escape to your island getaway—however, whenever, and wherever you want.

Powered by

item.title: How to Get All Tides of Terraria Pals in Palworld
item.description:
The worlds of Palworld and Terraria have collided in the colossal Tides of Terraria update, bringing players an adventure filled with monsters pulled straight from the iconic pixel-art survival crafting game. In Tides of Terraria , players can dive into dungeons, scavenge for valuable resources, and face the ultimate threat: the Moon Lord Raid Boss.

But that's not all—Tides of Terraria also introduces a new roster of Pals. Some are completely original creations, while others are creatures prominently featured in Terraria . Each one is a worthy addition to any player's Paldeck. With that said, here’s how to get every Pal included in the Tides of Terraria update for Palworld .

Herbil (No. 141)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Herbil Pulse:

  • While in a team, Herbil can revive the player when incapacitated.

  • Level 2 Planting
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 1 Gathering

Herbil is the first Pal that players can add to their Palpedia for the Tides of Terraria update. This small Grass/Neutral-type Pal can be found on three major islands introduced in the update: Oasis Isle , located east of the Dessicated Desert; Sunlit Isle , just south of Marsh Island; and the island where players can access the Sealed Realm of Terraria .

Icelyn (No. 142)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Witch's Icy Veil:

  • When fighting together, the player's attack type is changed to Ice.

  • Level 2 Handiwork
  • Level 2 Medicine Production
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 3 Cooling

Icelyn is another Pal introduced with the update and comes with a few neat stats, including a solid mix of Work Suitabilities and a handy Partner Skill, especially useful when taking on Dragon-type Pals. Icelyn’s natural habitat is the Frostbitten Isle , a remote island located far south of the Sea Breeze Archipelago.

Frostplume (No. 143)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Peacock Pounce:

  • When fighting together, the player's reload speed is increased.

  • Level 1 Gathering
  • Level 2 Cooling

Next up is another Ice-type Pal, Frostplume , a bird-like critter with a helpful Partner Skill. Just like Icelyn, Frostplume can almost exclusively be found on the Frostbitten Isle , an island far south of the Sea Breeze Archipelago.

Palumba (No. 144)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Samba Step:

  • Can be ridden, Pal moves faster on grass (requires a Palumba Saddle)

  • Level 2 Planting
  • Level 2 Gathering
  • Level 3 Mining

Keeping in line with bird-like Pals is Palumba , a Grass-type that also serves as a pretty solid ground mount. Palumba’s habitat spans two main islands: Oasis Isle , which borders the Dessicated Desert, and the island where the Sealed Realm of Terraria is located.

Braloha (No. 145)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Balmy Weather:

  • Can be ridden (requires a Braloha Saddle).
  • When at the base, it reduces the time it takes for Pals at a Breeding Farm to produce eggs.

  • Level 4 Planting
  • Level 4 Gathering
  • Level 2 Mining

Onto another ground mount now with Braloha , a Grass/Ground-type Pal that offers a nice bonus for players looking to breed powerful Pals, while also being quite handy for farming tasks back at base. While Braloha’s official habitat is listed as the island where the Sealed Realm of Terraria is located , it can also be found roaming around Oasis Isle , just like Palumba.

Munchill (No. 146)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Icy Maw:

  • When in a team, it cools down food in the player's inventory, making it less likely to spoil.

  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 1 Watering
  • Level 2 Cooling

Back to Ice Pals now with Munchill , a handy addition to any player’s roster—especially for those tired of their food spoiling too quickly. Munchill can be found in several icy regions, including the Frostbitten Isle and the Isle of the Glacial Core. The Pal can also be fished for at the Frostbound Mountains (near the Free Pal Alliance Tower) and the cold southern region of Feybreak Island.

Polapup (No. 147)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Rider of the Snowy Mountain:

  • Can be ridden, slides quickly down slopes (requires Polapup's Harness)

  • Level 2 Watering
  • Level 3 Cooling

Polapup is an Ice/Water Pal that also doubles as a ground mount, along with specializing in watering and cooling at the player's base. Polapup can be found on the Isle of the Glacial Core , and can also be fished for in the southern region of Feybreak Island.

Turtacle (No. 148)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Spikey Carrier:

  • While in a party, this Pal helps carry supplies by reducing the weight of the Armor in the player's inventory.

  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering
  • Level 1 Mining

Turtacle is a unique Water Pal that can be pretty great for those who want to reduce the weight of their armor. Players’ best bet for finding Turtacle is by heading to the Isle of Decaying Treasures , though this Pal can also be fished for on the Sunlit Isle and the Frostbitten Isle .

Turtacle can additionally be fished for across the Windswept Hills , Sea Breeze Archipelago , Marsh Island , Eastern Wild Island , Bamboo Groves , Moonless Shore , Verdant Brook , Forgotten Island , and Ice Wind Island —though spawns in these areas are less frequent.

Turtacle Terra (No. 148B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Shiny Hauler:

  • While in a party, this Pal helps carry supplies by reducing the weight of the Armor in the player's inventory.
  • Increases the attack power of Ground Pals.

  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering
  • Level 1 Mining

Turtacle Terra is another Pal that players can find, this time through fishing. This Ground/Water-type Pal can be fished up all around the Desiccated Desert , as well as at the Oasis Isle, the Sealed Realm of Terraria Island, and the Arena Entrance.

Jellroy (No. 149)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Jellroy Drop:

  • While in team, the items received when salvaging are increased.
  • When Jellroy and Jelliette are in your base, Jellroy's watering speed is increased.

  • Level 1 Handiwork
  • Level 1 Medicine Production
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering

Next up is Jellroy , a Water/Dark Pal that pairs particularly well with Jelliette. Jellroy's primary habitat is the Phantom Isle , located northwest of Mount Obsidian. Jellroy is active on the Phantom Isle during the day and can be fished for at night. During the night, however, it can also be fished for in the Isle of Decayed Treasures , Sunlit Isle , Frostbitten Isle , as well as other locations like the Forgotten Island , Ice Wind Island , Marsh Island , and Eastern Wild Island .

Jelliette (No. 150)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Jelliette Drop:

  • While in team, the items received from fishing are increased.
  • When Jellroy and Jelliette are in your base, Jelliette's watering speed is increased.

  • Level 1 Handiwork
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering

Jelliette is another Water Pal that players can capture, and it pairs exceptionally well with Jellroy. Jelliette can be found both day and night on the Frostbitten Isle. During the day, it can also be fished for on the Isle of Decayed Treasures , the Sunlit Isle , and potentially the Eastern Wild Island , Marsh Island , Windswept Hills , the Forgotten Island , and Ice Wind Island .

Gloopie (No. 151)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Sticky Princess:

  • When fighting together, the capture gauge that appears whilst fishing decreases slowly when the fishing bars are not overlapping.

  • Level 2 Handiwork
  • Level 2 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering

Gloopie is a Water/Dark-type Pal that tends to be fairly passive in the wild, making it much easier to capture. Gloopie spawns exclusively on the Isle of Decayed Treasures during the day , which is located just east of Eastern Wild Island. However, at night, Gloopie can also be fished for along the coasts of Sakurajima Island and Mount Obsidian.

Finsider (No. 152)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Echo Chamber:

  • Helps carry supplies, thus decreasing the weight of weapons in a player's inventory.

  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering

Finsider is a small, vibrant Water-type Pal that can lend a helping hand by reducing the load that weapons place on the player's inventory, as well as assisting with transporting and watering tasks. The best bet for finding Finsider is to travel to Sunlit Isle , located just south of Marsh Island. However, Finsider can also be fished for along the coastlines of the Desiccated Desert and Deep Sand Dunes , as well as on Oasis Isle , just east of the Desiccated Desert.

Finsider Ignis (No. 152B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Ember Chamber:

  • Helps carry supplies, thus decreasing the weight of weapons in a player's inventory.
  • Increases the attack power of Fire Pals

  • Level 2 Kindling
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering

Alongside Finsider is Finsider Ignis , a Water/Fire-type Pal that makes a neat addition to any player's Paldeck. Finsider Ignis can only be caught through fishing , with ideal fishing spots located in every region of Feybreak Island except the southern region, as well as on Phantom Isle.

Ghangler (No. 153)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Master Night Angler:

  • Can be ridden to travel across water (requires Ghangler Saddle).
  • When fighting together, it drastically reduces the time it takes for Pals to bite when fishing at night.

  • Level 2 Transporting
  • Level 4 Watering

Ghangler is a Dark/Water-type Pal that also doubles as a neat Water Mount. This fishy critter can exclusively be found at the Phantom Isle , often just bordering the island's coastline or patrolling the island itself. While the Pal itself can be found active at night, Ghanglers are also one of the few Dark Pals that are active during the day. At night, Ghangler can be fished for on the Phantom Isle , along with being fished for on Sakurajima Island.

Ghangler Ignis (No. 153B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Flame Lantern:

  • Can be ridden to travel across water (requires Ghangler Ignis Saddle).
  • When fighting together, it drastically reduces the time it takes for Pals to bite when fishing at night.

  • Level 3 Kindling
  • Level 2 Transporting
  • Level 4 Watering

Next up is Ghangler Ignis , a Fire/Water-type Pal that can only be acquired through fishing. Players can fish for Ghangler Ignis at specific spots across all major regions of Feybreak Island , excluding the cold southern region. It can also be fished up at the Oil Rig near Feybreak , as well as at the No. 2 Wildlife Sanctuary.

Whalaska (No. 154)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Chilled Whale Cruiser:

  • Can be ridden (requires Whalaska Saddle)
  • When fighting together, it gives players a head start on fishing mini-games by already filling the capture gauge.
  • The capture gauge increases more rapidly when the bars are overlapping.

  • Level 3 Watering
  • Level 4 Cooling

Whalaska is one of the larger Pals that players can encounter, serving as both a Water and Ice-type Pal. Its natural habitat is the Isle of the Glacial Core , where it can be found during both day and night. Additionally, an Alpha Whalaska can be encountered in the ocean north of the Astral Mountains.

Whalaska can also be fished up in the southern cold region of Feybreak Island , and may also be fished for near the Oil Rig off Feybreak , as well as another Oil Rig located near the Marsh Island.

Whalaska Ignis (No. 154B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Cozy Whale Cruiser:

  • Can be ridden (requires Whalaska Ignis Saddle)
  • When fighting together, it gives players a head start on fishing mini-games by already filling the capture gauge.
  • The capture gauge increases more rapidly when the bars are overlapping.

  • Level 3 Kindling
  • Level 4 Cooling

Following Whalaska is Whalaska Ignis , an Ice/Fire-type Pal that players can encounter. Currently, Whalaska Ignis can be found as an Alpha Pal , located off the coast of the Beach of Everlasting Summer near Mount Obsidian. However, players can also fish for the Pal around Feybreak Island and the Oil Rig near Feybreak.

Neptilius (No. 155)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Sentinel of the Great Sea:

  • Follows player attacks with Spear Strikes when in a Party.
  • Can be ridden as a Water Mount, with the ability to leap out over the water (requires Neptilius Saddle).

  • Level 4 Watering

Neptilus is another Alpha Pal that players can add to their growing roster and belongs to the Water category of Pals. To find and catch it, players will need to head over to the Isle of the Glacial Core —an island located northwest of the Deep Sand Dunes. There, Neptilus can be found within the Sealed Realm of the Glacial Core , which is accessible just ahead of the island’s fast travel point.

Pengullet Lux (No. 10B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Pengullet Lux Launcher:

  • Equips a rocket launcher where Pengullet Lux can be fired as the ammunition
  • (requires Pengullet Lux's Rocket Launcher)

  • Level 1 Handiwork
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 1 Watering
  • Level 2 Generating Electricity

Moving onto old Pals that have received new variants, next is Pengullet Lux , a Water/Electric Pal. Pengullet Lux can currently only be caught by fishing at night in the Desiccated Desert and on the Isle of Decayed Treasures.

Penking Lux (No. 11B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Unyielding Storm Commander:

  • While fighting together, Water Pals drop more items when defeated.

  • Level 2 Handiwork
  • Level 2 Transporting
  • Level 2 Watering
  • Level 2 Generating Electricity
  • Level 2 Mining

Keeping with Water/Electric Pals, there is Penking Lux. This Pal can also only be found via fishing and can be caught all around Sakurajima Island and the Phantom Isle.

Killamari Primo (No. 23B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Fried Killamar:

  • While in the team, modifies the glider to enable gentle gliding and extend gliding time (requires Killamari Primo's Gloves)

  • Level 2 Transporting
  • Level 1 Watering
  • Level 1 Gathering

Killamari Primo is another Pal that can be fished for, one that is relatively easy to get. Killamari Primo can be fished up at Mount Obsidian. Alternatively, players can also encounter this Pal in the Sealed Realm of Terraria .

Celaray Lux (No. 24B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Jolt Glider:

  • While in the team, increases gliding speed and duration (requires Celaray Lux's Gloves)

  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 1 Watering
  • Level 1 Generating Electricity

Following Killamari Primo is Celaray Lux , which can also only be caught by fishing. Players can fish for Celaray Lux on Oasis Isle , as well as around the Cold Shore and Verdant Brook.

Dumud Gild (No. 43B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Golden Harvest:

  • While in team, it increases the attack power of Ground Pals.
  • Sometimes drops High Quality Oil at the Ranch.
  • Has a small chance of dropping Gold Coins at a Ranch.

  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 1 Watering
  • Level 2 Mining
  • Level 1 Farming

Another special variant players can get is Dumud Gild —a Pal that will be particularly useful for those looking to increase their High Quality Pal Oil and Golden Coin yield. This Pal can be found within the Sealed Realm of Terraria , but can also be fished for in a few bodies of water in the Dessicated Desert , as well as around Oasis Isle and the island where the Sealed Realm of Terraria can be accessed.

Azurobe Cryst (No. 82B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Icewing Dance:

  • Can be ridden to travel on water (requires Azurobe Cryst Saddle).
  • Changes the player's attack type to ice when mounted.

  • Level 3 Cooling

Next is Azurobe Cryst , an Ice/Dragon Pal that serves as a useful water mount. Azurobe Cryst can only be caught by fishing and can potentially be found in the cold southern region of Feybreak , as well as at the Rayne Syndicate Platform Oil Rig.

Croajiro Noct (No. 114B)

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Golden Harvest:

  • When activated, it propels the player into the air.
  • While in the team, it increases the attack power of Dark Pals.

  • Level 1 Handiwork
  • Level 1 Transporting
  • Level 1 Watering
  • Level 1 Gathering

Croajiro Noct is another Pal that serves as a special variant of one seen in the past. This Pal can only be caught through fishing , with it commonly being found in the waters of Sakurajima Island.

All Terarria Pals

This final set of Pals are monsters from Terraria , which players can encounter within the Sealed Realm of Terraria , accessible from a small island off the coast of Fisherman's Point. While these monsters will not show up in the Palpedia, they can be captured just like any other Pal.

Slime

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Slime Body:

  • Can be ridden without a saddle.
  • Can jump high into the air when mounted.

  • Level 1 Transporting

Slimes are one of the more common enemies within the Sealed Realm of Terraria , and come in different colors, each belonging to a different element. However, all Slimes are relatively the same, with the only difference being their elemental attacks.

Demon Eye

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Demonic Sight:

  • While in a team, it increases the attack power of Dark Pals.

  • Level 1 Transporting

Another common enemy of Terraria is the Demon Eye Sight , taking the form of a Dark Pal in Palworld . Demon Eyes are pretty neat, providing a buff to other Dark Pals.

Enchanted Sword

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Enchant:

  • While in a team, Dark Pals drop more items when defeated.

  • Level 1 Lumbering

While not as common as the previous enemy types, the Enchanted Sword can be encountered within the cave areas of the Sealed Realm of Terraria. This particular Pal is great for increasing the drops of slain Dark Pals, making it a decent addition to the player's Paldeck.

Cave Bat

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Bat Backup:

  • While in a team, it appears near the players.
  • Automatically picks up nearby items

  • Level 1 Gathering

Cave Bats are another enemy type that, like the Slimes, come in a few different forms. Once captured and in the player's party, the Cave Bat will appear without being summoned and will pick up items for the player, even if another Pal is already summoned.

Eye of Cthulhu

Partner Skill

Work Suitability

Mad Eye Lunge:

  • When activated, Eye of Cthulhu charges and attacks a targeted enemy.

  • Level 4 Transporting

Last up is the Eye of Cthulhu , the dungeon boss that players will encounter at the end of the Sealed Realm of Terraria . This Dark Pal comes with its own unique set of skills, making it an excellent choice for those looking to take on some of the tougher Tower Bosses in the game.

Palworld
130
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Pocket Pair, Inc.
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X

item.title: Ready or Not Making Content Changes for Console Release
item.description:
The upcoming Ready or Not console ports will introduce some content changes compared to the original version of the game, Void Interactive has announced. While the differences aren't significant, the Ready or Not developer says it decided to outline them publicly for transparency purposes.

December 17 will mark the fourth anniversary of Ready or Not launching in early access. The tactical first-person shooter was treated to a full-fledged release almost exactly two years later, in December 2023. Since then, Void Interactive redirected some of its resources toward porting the game to consoles. The Irish developer recently committed to a July 15 release date for the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S versions of the game.

Ahead of next month's launch, Void Interactive revealed that the upcoming Ready or Not console ports won't be identical to the PC original. The studio elected to make some targeted changes to the game's content in order to ensure it meets console certification standards from Sony and Microsoft. These include reducing several depictions of nudity and torture, as well as altering in-game depictions of child mistreatment.

Ready or Not Console Version Is Only Censoring What's 'Absolutely Required'

"There is no reason [for fans] to be alarmed" about any of these changes, a Void Interactive official said in a prepared statement, noting that the developer only elected to censor content that its platform partners "flagged as absolutely required." Even these mandatory instances of censorship were handled carefully, with the full intent to preserve the game's tone. The console versions of Ready or Not should hence offer an authentic experience.

Some Ready or Not Console Content Changes Will Affect PC Players

While the limited content changes were prompted by console certification standards, some will also be applied to the PC version of the tactical shooter. The distinction between cross-platform and console-specific censorship largely depends on feasibility and practicality. Simple texture swaps—such as altering in-game evidence to remove partial nudity or images of children—are one-time edits that Void Interactive can easily keep console-exclusive. However, modifying entire assets, like adding clothing to a nude character model, is significantly harder to deploy selectively. For the sake of maintainability, such changes will be implemented across all platforms.

All Confirmed Ready or Not Content Changes

  • Dismemberment is still present but only occurs while enemies are alive.
  • Torture visuals were slightly toned down (e.g. less exaggerated wounds).
  • Some nudity was reduced (e.g. civilian/suspect coverage).
  • Violent animations involving children were softened (e.g. child shown sleeping instead of convulsing).
  • Evidence textures on console were modified to be less explicit, but implications remain clear.

Void Interactive believes that the vast majority of its newly confirmed changes are minor to the point of being barely noticeable. The most obvious exception is the dismemberment system, which is still present but was disabled for deceased enemies. The developer described this as an acceptable compromise on account of Ready or Not already discouraging the use of lethal force as a core design principle.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: What Happens to Extra Stars at the End of Star Wars GO in Monopoly GO?
item.description:
Monopoly GO has been running the Star Wars GO album for the past couple of months. It’s been such a fun ride, especially for Star Wars fans. Collecting stickers, completing sticker packs, and chasing the awesome rewards has been exciting for players.

But now, the album is about to end on July 2 . With only a few days left, a lot of tycoons are starting to wonder: what happens to the extra stars once the Star Wars GO album ends? If you have been thinking the same thing, this guide will explain it all. Keep reading to find out.

What Happens to Extra Stars at the End of Star Wars GO?

When you open sticker packs, you get a random bunch of stickers. This means players will often get duplicate stickers. It happens to everyone, but luckily, you don’t have to hold onto these extras. You can either trade them with your friends or convert them into stars.

The stars you collect can be used to open vaults and grab some pretty sweet rewards. But you can only do this while the Star Wars GO album is still active. Once it’s over, fans won’t be able to use their stars anymore.

To open the vaults, you just need to head over to the Stickers for Rewards menu in the game. Here’s a quick look at what each vault costs and what you can get:

Vault

Cost

Rewards

Orange Vault

250 Stars

200 Dice Rolls, Three-Star Sticker Pack

Blue Vault

450 Stars

350 Dice Rolls, Three-Star and Four-Star Sticker Packs

Gold Vault

700 Stars

500 Dice Rolls, Four-Star and Five-Star Sticker Packs, Swap Pack

After the album ends on July 02, all your leftover stars will automatically be turned into dice rolls. However, the most you can get is 750 dice rolls for 700 stars . If you have more stars than that, the extra ones will sadly just go to waste.

So for example, if you have 950 stars, you should definitely open at least one vault before the album ends to avoid losing the extras. And if you are still trying to finish your Star Wars GO sticker sets, it’s actually smarter to spend all your stars now and open the Gold Vault. It gives you 500 dice, a blue four-star sticker pack, a purple five-star sticker pack, and a swap pack. The Star Wars GO sticker album started on May 01 and is set to end on July 02.
